Working Title   Chief Information Officer (CIO)   Posting Number   NFE01462P   Department   DSU-President   Physical Location of Position (City)   Madison   Posting Text  Dakota State University in Madison, SD  (https://www.dsu.edu) invites inquiries, applications, and nominations for the position of Chief Information Officer (CIO). DSU seeks a strategic thought leader, collaborative campus partner, and proven administrator with an innovative, consistent track record of quality improvement and data-driven decisions as CIO.  The South Dakota Board of Regents has constitutional authority to govern the system of public higher education in the State of South Dakota. Supported by an Executive Director and staff, the Board provides leadership and sets policies for the programs and services delivered through its six universities and two special schools. The CIO has frequent interaction with Regents’ staff as well as serving on the system-wide Technology Affairs Council (TAC).  As a mission-specific specialty University within the South Dakota Board of Regents system of higher education, Dakota State University was founded (1881) as a school for teacher education, in the Dakota Territory. Though we have since shifted our primary focus of education to the cyber world, Dakota State remains one of the few universities in the nation providing students with the technology needed to excel in any career.  Dakota State University offers undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral programs through its colleges of arts and sciences, business and information systems, computer and cyber sciences, and education. DSU has a special focus on the development, application, implications, and impacts of computing, information technologies and cyber security in all areas of human endeavor. DSU has received multiple Center of Excellence designations in education, research and regional resource development from the U.S. National Security Agency and U.S. Department of Homeland Security. DSU is home to the Madison Cyber Labs (MadLabs®), a cyber research & development hub with labs and institutes that explore and advance technology application, workforce development, business expansion, economic growth, and policy improvement across multiple disciplines and fields, and the Applied Research Lab (ARL).  Reporting directly to President, this cabinet-level leader is part of the University leadership team putting together a dynamic and synergistic strategic direction. This leader will have the opportunity to provide leadership, support, and intellectual tools that will help solidify and grow a unique and innovative set of initiatives. Reporting to this position are the Director of Administrative Services & Development, Director of K-12 Data Center, Director of Technical Operations, Director of Support Services, and Manager of Multimedia Services. The CIO is responsible to lead, direct, and manage campus data communications, academic technology, administrative systems, financial technology, training, user support, and IT security systems; serve as an institutional expert on the impact of emerging trends in the information technology field and uses in higher education; define and set policies and standards, used by the entire organization, regarding computing services and use of information technology; oversee the design and implementation of new applications and changes to existing computer systems and software; manage information technology needs across the entire organization while maintaining alignment with the organizational mission of being a technology leader; provide tactical and strategic planning for the ongoing management of cyber security platforms; assess hardware, software, and services being considered for development, purchase, or implementation for security strengths/risks and information security features; work as leader in areas of risk management, disaster recovery planning, and business continuity planning for information technology services.  Position Description: Key duties of the CIO at Dakota State University include providing institution-wide leadership and direction in the management and operation of shared information services across the University; leads, guides, and oversees the institutional information technology budgeting process providing leadership in cost and productivity analysis; works with the University Chief Technology Officer (CTO) in determining the priorities, projects, and future directions of the University’s IT functions; responsible for leading and directing the IT workforce of the University.  Required Qualifications: The ideal candidate must have strong written and verbal communication skills. Key characteristics include:  Strong organizational skills while managing the University’s IT systems and functions, creating, and delivering strategies and policies.  Strong leadership skills working with complex budgets, organizational development, personnel, problem solving, and conflict resolution.  Recruiting staff requiring they work proactively to source and nurture the best employees possible.  Collaboration and relationship building within the division and with diverse campus and community partners.  Ability to articulate IT vision for a progressive IT organization.   The successful candidate for CIO will be able to demonstrate these minimum qualifications: Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Network & Security Administration, or closely related discipline from a regionally-accredited U.S. University or equivalent international institution; ten years of experience in Information Technology, including the supervision of an IT department; proven information technology leader with a broad range of technology experience and demonstrated experience working with all levels of personnel and executives.  Unique Opportunity:  Dakota State University is a distinguished regional and national leader in computer science and cybersecurity education and research. We embrace opportunities to provide our students, faculty, and future collaborators with the most innovative technologies and facilities, to produce transformative research and development, and create an outstanding base of faculty, students, and programs at the bachelor’s, master’s, and Ph.D. levels. The major University initiative is DSU RISING, a gift-driven campaign in two phases, totaling $130 Million. Phase 1 (2017) produced several major new opportunities and facilities on campus. Included is the home of The Beacom College of Computer and Cyber Sciences, dynamic growth in undergraduate and graduate enrollments, the completion of the Madison CyberLabs (provides our faculty, students, and researchers the space, technology, and infrastructure to support exploration in cyber-related research and technology application across many industries) and the completion of the Applied Research Lab (DSU-ARL), the University’s research lab. In DSU RISING Phase 2 (2022) we see the extension of DSU’s Applied Research Lab (ARL) to Sioux Falls and the movement to expand the number of graduates from The Beacom College of Computer and Cyber Sciences. This project includes a 100,000 square foot facility to house the expanded DSU Applied Research Lab, an initiative to double the cyber graduates from The Beacom College (from around 200 per year to 400 per year), expand DSU-ARL Management and Security, expand Merit-based Student Scholarships in cyber education, and launch the Governor’s Cyber Academy (a statewide K-12 cyber education program).  A related supportive function established on campus is the new Paulson Cyber Incubator and Entrepreneurial Center.
